sentences.sContent: He was better at teaching artillery than natural philosophy, and was disliked by some cadets for his brusqueness, lack of sympathy and eccentric behavior.
sentences.sContent_eng: He was better at teaching artillery than natural philosophy, and was disliked by some cadets for his brusqueness, lack of sympathy and eccentric behavior.
sentences.sCn: 与自然哲学相较，他更擅长教授炮兵战术原则，因为他的直率，缺乏同情以及古怪的行为，一些学员并不喜欢他。

remMethod.val: 来自brusque(adj. 寡言而无礼的)
